channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Workers around the nation have managed to keep working remotely during the pandemic. Why not our federal politicians?
item.title: No excuse for shutting Parliament in the digital age

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Welcome to the Age and Sydney Morning Herald live blog for the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Coronavirus Australia update LIVE: Victoria sees COVID-19 spike continue with 363 new cases and three more deaths, NSW advices against non-essential travel, Australia death toll at 122

item.description: A Robbie Gray match-winner after the siren broke Carlton hearts at the Gabba on Sunday but the Blues lost no friends as they took the league-leading Port Adelaide to the wire.
item.title: Port snatch victory after the siren against Blues

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Sam Reid is in the frame to play his first game of the season as skipper Luke Parker asked fans to stick with the Swans through their growing pains.
item.title: 'Stick with us': Parker urges fans to keep faith as Reid eyes return

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Competition hierarchy made the decision on SaturdayÂ night, meaning players across the country woke up to the news on Sunday that they will spend at least part of the season in the Sunshine State.
item.title: COVID-19 forces 11th-hour move of Super Netball to Queensland

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews has warned the chance of being caught flouting coronavirus restrictions has never been greater as police take on new task of enforcing mask-wearing fines.
item.title: Man crossing Melbourne to go fishing among 127 fined

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: The 31-year-old princess married property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi in a Norman Hartnell gown first worn by her grandmother.
item.title: Princess Beatrice's vintage wedding dress a nod to the Queen

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Giants spearhead Jeremy Cameron believes critics have been too quick to jump on the back of captain Stephen Coniglio.
item.title: 'The right guy for the job': Cameron backs under-fire Coniglio amid GWS slump

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The Supreme Court has ruled that a defamation trial due to start next week between Mr Gatto and the Australian Broadcasting Corporation will not be heard before a jury, but by a judge alone, after his legal team bungled the paper work.
item.title: No jury for Gatto defamation trial after lawyer bungle

item.description: Public anger has been compounded by corruption alleged against Benjamin Netanyahu, who went on trial in May for bribery, fraud and breach of trust - charges he denies.
item.title: Israelis protest against Netanyahu government handling of COVID-19 crisis

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: If the Fabulous Botting Flower felt hemmed in by its own passion for Americana, 19 years ago Darren Percival was flying free.
item.title: The Fabulous Botting Flower: More than four ways to sing a song

item.description: The tweet accused of breaking copyright contained a video with music by rock group Linkin Park.
item.title: Twitter disables Trump 'campaign' tweet over copyright complaint

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Wearing a face covering outside the home will be mandatory from Thursday and those who fail to comply could face $200 fines.
item.title: Masks made mandatory, aged care visits limited as 363 cases announced

item.description: Britain named NEC Corp and Fujitsu Ltd as potential alternative suppliers to Huawei, according to reports.
item.title: UK asks Japan to replace Huawei in 5G networks: report

item.description: Jon Rahm showed on Saturday why he's such an explosive player, with his clubs. It just might be what takes him to No.1 in the world.
item.title: Rahm builds four-shot lead at Memorial in his quest to be No.1

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: Police used capsicum spray to break up a brawl at the party which more than 60 people attended.
item.title: Dozens face $1000 fines after Sydney house party breaches COVID rules

item.dc:creator: Alex Druce
item.description: Australian shares are tipped to rise as investors await detail from the federal government on its COVID-19 support plan after September.
item.title: Investors wait for budget response to COVID-19

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: As significant as this match is for WA in the current COVID-hit landscape, there's much riding on the 51st derby for both clubs, who are on the cusp of the top eight and eyeing a win to kick off their extended run at home.Â
item.title: How underdog Dockers can win Western Derby 51

item.description: In isolation, Melbourne band Mildlife found themselves with an album to finish.
item.title: Mildlife's second wave is far from mild

item.description: The fusion of chess and boxing into the hybrid sport of "chessboxing" has provoked controversy, but its supporters say it makes chess "sexy".
item.title: Chessboxing: ultimate test of brains and brawn or a 'freak show'?

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: NSW residents are being urged to "redouble their efforts" to stop the virus spreading by avoiding non-essential travel and social gatherings.
item.title: NSW warns of 'inherent risk' on public transport as 18 coronavirus cases detected

item.description: Williams' George Russell defended Red Bull's Alex Albon after out-qualifying his old friend and rival, drawing a rebuff from Max Verstappen.
item.title: Verstappen tells Russell to mind his own business

item.description: Plexus performed a concert of pieces commissioned from Australian women: the result was richly rewarding.
item.title: Trio shine a light on women composers' new works

item.description: Follow all the action from Sunday's three matches, starting with Carlton and the Power.
item.title: Live AFL scores: Carlton v Port Adelaide, Hawthorn v Melbourne, Fremantle v West Coast

item.description: Lewis Hamilton celebrated a record-extending and "surreal" 90th career pole position on Saturday after a dominant Mercedes one-two in Hungarian Grand Prix qualifying.
item.title: Hamilton takes record 90th career pole in Hungary

item.description: The week in photos from our award winning photographers and regular contributing photographers at The Age.
item.title: The Age photos of the week, July 19, 2020

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Consumers are steadily gaining access to a range of tools to enhance their online shopping experience. But can virtual clothes ever replace a trip to the shops?
item.title: The fitting room of the future is in the palm of your hand

item.description: âYouâre killing an innocent man,â Lee said, looking directly at me. Those were his last words. He said them to me.
item.title: 'Like watching someone go to sleep': Inside the witness room for an American execution

item.description: Downcast North Melbourne senior coach Rhyce Shaw insists the club took a cautious approach with skipper Jack Ziebell but will now have to pick up the pieces from another hamstring injury to the Kangaroos captain.
item.title: Roos 'don't have enough blokes rowing the boat': Shaw

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: Ante Milicic has confirmed he won't stay on as Matildas coach, choosing to honour his deal with incoming A-League expansion outfit Macarthur FC.
item.title: Milicic steps down from Matildas as FFA officially begins hunt for new coach

item.description: Amid a fresh outbreak, Iran has reintroduced restrictions in Tehran and other parts of the nation.
item.title: Iran president says coronavirus outbreak may be 100 times worse than previously thought

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Nick Xenophon, a former senator, has resisted calls to register saying he only provides legal advice to the Chinese firm.
item.title: 'Difficult to believe': Malcolm Turnbull renews calls for Nick Xenophon to declare work for Huawei

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A large protest marking seven years of Australia's current offshore detention policy for refugees is expected to cause large traffic delays at Kangaroo Point.
item.title: Refugee protest to block Kangaroo Point traffic on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The family lived in Biloela, near Gladstone, before they were detained during a police raid in March 2018 and taken to Melbourne.
item.title: Mother from detained Tamil family medically evacuated from Christmas Island, supporters say

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The Queensland government has promised extra funds for the RSPCA in the 2019-20 state budget as the high-profile animal charity declares a five-fold increase in wildlife seeking care.
item.title: State government commits new funds for RSPCA as new hospital bid grows

item.description: Seven months after leaving Pep Guardiola's side, Mikel Arteta outwitted his mentor to ensure his first season as Arsenal manager will end with an FA Cup final.
item.title: Arteta outwits Guardiola: Arsenal beat City, reach final

item.dc:creator: Iain Payten
item.description: The Australian Winter Olympic community is in mourning again after the death of young figure skater Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya.
item.title: Australian team rocked by death of second Winter Olympian

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: Six teenagers were in the Holden station wagon when it crashed into a fence just before midnight, killing one of the passengers.
item.title: Teen killed after Commodore carrying six people crashes on Northern Beaches

item.description: Princess Beatrice wore a vintage dress loaned to her by her grandmother Queen Elizabeth II.
item.title: Royal Family releases Princess Beatrice's wedding photos

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Leaked documents detail how the doping scandal has wrecked friendships and prompted conflict and even an assault at the very heart of the racing industry.
item.title: Clashes and clashing heads: How Aquanita has riven Victorian racing

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: The 1980 Moscow Olympic Games divided the nation, including our athletes.
item.title: Death threats and abuse: The Australian Olympians who defied PM to compete in Moscow 40 years ago

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: One of the state's top planners says Covid-19 presents a "generational catastrophe" that will reshape every aspect of how Australian cities are planned, and put major developments in Melbourne into question.
item.title: 'Generational catastrophe': How COVID-19 could reshape Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Ben Schneiders
item.description: Leader of Victoriaâs powerful construction union has targeted his comrades in the labour movement while making peace with employers heâs fought for decades.
item.title: John Setka's war on everyone

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: The Wests Tigers enforcer has taken an incredible stand against fellow NRL stars â even past and present teammates â who took issue with the Channel Nine commentator.
item.title: âI stand with Erinâ: Aloiai slams fellow players for criticism of presenter

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The NRL is conducting due diligence after an approach from a firm representing cashed-up private investors wanting a piece of rugby league.
item.title: Sale of the century: NRL in talks about potential $1 billion equity deal

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Officers began investigating after two 11-year-old girls and a 12-year-old boy were admitted to hospital for suspected overdoses of MDMA on the state's Central Coast.
item.title: Police search for man who allegedly supplied MDMA to children amid declining drug use in young people

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: Residents from the last public housing tower to remain on "hard lockdown" can leave their homes from midnight.
item.title: 'Singing and dancing all day': Alfred Street tower residents to taste freedom

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Felicity and Adam Moreau tried to conceive a baby for 10 years before becoming one of a growing number of families to adopt a child from foster care in NSW.
item.title: 'Amazing extended family': Adoption rates rise in NSW

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The Sydney lord mayor has shocked residents by saying that anyone who objects to temporary bike paths in the inner city "doesn't care about saving lives".
item.title: 'Riding roughshod': Clover Moore clashes with councillors, residents over cycleways
